text:
In 2.0.3 (possibly earlier) if you merge two test plans with different
User-Defined variables on the Test plan Node, the variables from the Merged (ie,
second) test plan are skipped.

STR:
1. Create a Test plan with a user-defined variable on the Test plan node named
TEST_PLAN_1 and give it a value, add a Thread Group.
2. Save the Test plan.
3. Create a test plan with a user-defined variable on the Test plan node named
TEST_PLAN_2 and give it a value, add a Thread Group.
4. Save the Test plan.
5. Open the test plan from step 2 and Merge it with the one from step 4.
6. Observe that TEST_PLAN_1 is the only user-defined variable on the test plan
node. (If the test plans were merged properly, you should see both TEST_PLAN_1
and TEST_PLAN_2 in the list on the Test Plan node).

NOTE: This doesn't happen if you only define the variables. The existance of the
Thread Group looks to have something to do with the cause here.

Clarrification: I'm talking about defining User-defined variable here on the
Test Plan node, and not by using a User-Defined Variables node.
creator: jmeter@binarytwo.com
sebb@apache.org
text:
I'm not sure that it makes sense to merge test plans like this; the intent of
the Merge function is to be able to include test-plan snippets, not whole plans.
